name: Trump International Beach Resort

reviews.text: We arrived at this hotel Feb 1, 2013 and checked out Feb 5, 2013
reviews.title: Clean but not 5 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property is very clean. The bed linens and towels were pristine white. The bathrooms were just okay. The sink was made of plastic and the countertop, althoug granite, it was an ugly, cheap-looking granite. The faucets were cheap-looking as well. The hairdryer took me twice the time to dry my hair as the one at home. There was a bathroom scale, but non-functioning. If it doesn't work, just remove it from the room or replace it with one that works. The balcony was nice and large with nice patio furniture. Be careful when you book a room here if you want an ocean front view. There is "Ocean view" and "Ocean front." Big difference. If you want ot wake up and easily see the ocean, get the "Ocean view." If you don't mind mostly views of the street and a view of the ocean if you stick your head out a bit, then get the "Ocean view" room. But, I would pay the extra money for the Ocean Front. The pillow-top Serta mattresses were divinely comfy :-) Each room comes with a wet bar with cabinets full of snacks, drinking glasses, wine glasses, and a Keurig coffee maker. They provide the coffee and accessories complimentary. There were two terry-cloth robes with slippers, so that was great. the foyer and bathroom floors are marble, so the slippers are very much appreciated. The decor is nice, not fantastic, but nice. the flat screen tv was pleaseantly big. The room drapes were not completely light-blocking, which would have been nice for mornings when you want to sleep in.
reviews.title: If you tweak it, you will love it.

reviews.text: The pool area was very nice. the attendents were very friendly and helpful. This hotel is 30 floors up, one tower, however, there is a property next door called the "Trump Grande" which are condominums and they have access to the hotel pools and ammenities. So, although the pool deck is beautiful, I think it's a bit small for the number of rooms/people it is supposed to accomodate. Get to the pool area as early as possible for a good lounge chair. The pool water was a bit too chilly to enjoy during the winter months.For a 5 star hotel, I think they could afford to turn up the heat a bit during the wintery months. We opted to stay in one of their 3 hot tubs ("spas") to keep warm, but the chlorine content faded my swimsuit, so beware. The poolside menu was delicious and not too over-priced.
reviews.title: Fantastic beach front hotel with great staff!

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet is way overpriced for what you get. None of the food super high quality nor was it organic. When you get your bill, the price of the buffet is $24, however after they add taxes, gratuity, and fees, it comes out to $30 per person. But, the servers were very friendly and the outdoor seating area was very nice. I think that $22 for the buffet, total with everything, would be a more fair price for what they are offering. The fruit, although not organic, was sweet and seasonal. If you want water, it is served in tiny glasses that are not refilled often enough.
reviews.title: Pretty good hotel..

reviews.text: The smell of the hotel is arromatic and lovely. The corridors of the rooms were nice but not great. The good thing was that the layout of the floors to the rooms was designed to reduce noise. Straight, long hallways tend to carry a lot of sound from the elevator, etc. But, Trump International does not have this problem. So, cudos for that :-)
reviews.title: Beautiful location and appearance does not Trump poor management and service

reviews.text: This is one of the best hotels to go to in miami.The rooms are big ,some even have a washer and dryer.They have a kids pool which is always a plus for me.The view from the hotel room was beautiful.Service is really good they treat you like royalty.They have extras like complimentry ices at 3 for the kids ,smoothies throughout the day and ect.I will definitly be going back there next time im in miami.
reviews.title: Great hotel for kids

reviews.text: The front desk was helpful in fixing things that went wrong during our 3 day stay- AC and Safe didn't work. t once working AC leaked onto floor. No creamers for coffee 3 days running even after asking and leaving a $10 tip for housekeeping, very small bathroom, peeling wallpaper, closet sliders didn't slide. Manager refused all late checkouts.
reviews.title: Not up to Trump standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But all the common areas were nice and our ocean front room had a nice view. Pool and beach attendants were all nice, and beach chairs are included in the $22/day resort fee. Poolside lunch was very good- $130 for 4 people no alcohol drinks). Breakfast also good, $130 for 4.
reviews.title: Our little piece of Paradise

reviews.text: This location is 30+ minutes from South beach by cab.
reviews.title: Outstanding views and great beach

reviews.text: My husband and I started going to The Trump International in 2008. We went there for our 20th Anniversary and immediately fell in love with the place. We have been back every year since!
reviews.title: Stunning Views
Nice people, good location, solid
reviews.text: This is now my third stay in the Oceanpoint. I am sure there are far better options, but I like the place. It gives me enough anonymity yet also feel welcome. It has a prime beach location, a small but decent pool and some jacuzzi-ish pools around the main pool. I can see that at busy tourist times the place can get crowded and staff might have difficulties satisfying guests, because the place aroudn the pool gets cramped - but then again, there's a beach which is large enough for everyone.

The hotel does need some improvements on some issues. I also saw wallpaper in the bathroom peeling off, which looked a bit cheap and dirty. The bathrooms of the suites are certainly not the best and are below the standard of the hotel. I had a bathroom with a large jacuzzi which did not make sense. I don't need a jacuzzi which takes ages (really) to fill and the sound sof the jacuzzi will certainly wake up the whole floor. The jacuzzi was not an added value but rather a nuisance. That can't be right. Also the kithchen, though large and with all amenities, is dated.
reviews.title: NIce place to perch on beach-get an ocean view room

reviews.text: For the rest a super place with good folk.
reviews.title: We had such a gear time here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Typical high-rise hotel on Northern Miami Beach. A bit isolated from areas in Miami--So Beach, etc, so plan to stay around hotel for activities. Nice pool for lap swimming. OK spa. Food is quite good, so plan a few meals on property. The beach is clean and well appointed with chairs, towels, etc. Staff is attentive. Front desk staff is not adequate. Couldn't get my bill corrected even though I discussed at length with staff and eventually the front desk manager. Finally gave up and just paid the ~ $90 overage so I could make a flight.
reviews.title: Perfection !

reviews.text: Very pricy, exorbitant taxes and fees, but we would still go again. The rooms were nice and the staff went out of their way to make sure they were clean. If you don't put the "do not disturb" sign in your door they will come in upwards of three times a day. The pools were amazing! There is an upper and lower pool, both heated, with beautiful views and three hot tubs. The pool area service was wonderful. We especially enjoyed seeing Kolea Williams and Cheryl every day of our stay. They were especially welcoming, professional and helpful. Kolea is very hard working and really cares about making sure the pool guests are happy and enjoying their stay.
reviews.title: Very nice, but $$$$
Very Nice!!!!
reviews.text: I had a blast!! The staff was great and them room was clean and the view was great! Try to get the highest floor you can with ocean view. The minute we arrived the staff was helpful and very attentive.

reviews.title: Just Eh.....
reviews.text: I am just returning from a 4 night stay over the New Year's holiday that was booked through Orbitz. My wife and I both found the hotel to be so-so. We are both in our early 30's.

reviews.title: Slightly disappointed
reviews.text: The hotel was strange in many ways: The lobby was very nice, but the hotel entrance is Holiday Inn Express at best, consisting of 2 small sliding doors that could barely allow for patrons to exit and enter at the same time. We arrived on a Friday night at 11PM and there was noone insight to take our bags, so I carried them up the front steps myself. The lobby was on Floor L, the pool and beach were on Floor 2, but to get to the Beach you had to walk through the pool then down 3 flights of stairs to below the Lobby level. We were on the 18th floor, and this is not an exaggeration, it would take 15 minutes to go from our room to the beach. The elevators were good for one thing, toning up! As we took the stairs more then 10 times from the pool to the 18th floor.

reviews.title: Beware of hidden charges
reviews.text: Kid Friendly: This would be great for us if we had kids, as the hotel was jammed packed with them. The main pool was impossible to use because of all of the screaming children. The best part is, when we arrived poolside at 10am on Day 1, we were told that no seats were available at the Main pool, but they could seat us at the "Kid Pool" down stairs. Um, exactly where was the adult pool?

reviews.title: A great hotel with small things to improve
reviews.text: WiFi: Cost $9:95/day, but does not work on the beach, head back up 3 flights of stairs to sit at the Kid Bar.

I was at a conference held at this Hotel in November. The front desk staff were wonderful, the bell men were very helpful. The room was filthy. It had a lot of wear and tear for a room at this caliber. I asked to change rooms because the first room had dirty towels on the balcony, it made me question how clean everything else would be. The chairs had stains from coffee or soda on the seats. What bothered me most about this hotel has more to do with Miami than the hotel. There were skyscrapers in every directions as far as you could see. When sitting by the pool, they blocked the sun. The hotel is a good 45 minute ride to the South Beach area. I would not return to this hotel for a vacation, but if I'm sent there for business, I'll take it.
reviews.title: Skyscrapers ruin the veiw

likes.liked: — across the street from a great Columbian restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I made a reservation trough their web page for cristhmas, and they changed the amounto to be paid.
reviews.title: Be Carefull They Changed Prices

reviews.text: they are very informals
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: don't trust them
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Just got back from a Thanksgiving weekend stay at Trump Sonesta. We had a deluxe studio - ocean view for the three of us: my 5yrd old daughter , husband and myself. When asked about an upgrade at the check in (based on prior reviews of this hotel), we were only offered it for an extra pay, and so we declined. The hotel is nice, but all the extras are pretty expensive. Valet parking is $24 per night , breakfast buffet is $21 per person plus 18% service charge which is mandatory plus high tax. Internet services is $10 per 24-hours, the use of business center internet is even more expensive, something like $18 per every 15 min. The pool is great, but the main pool will be closed for repairs from now until December 17th. The beach is great. One afternoon there was a free animal show for kids which was nice (however, we didn't know about it until the security guard we met in the elevator told us). On the last day we needed a later check-out because our flight home wasn't until 4 in the afternoon, and they didn't mind. In fact we left at 2 pm instead of 11, so that was very nice of them. Overall, we were pleased with the experience at this hotel, although it 's a little bit overpriced.
reviews.title: Not what you'd expect from Trump

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed during February 2013. Our room was clean and comfortable. We had an excellent view of the Ocean. The staff was courteous and helpful. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was expensive but the food was very good. We have stayed in other hotels on Sunny Isles that do not compare with Trump. Overall, we absolutely loved the hotel and would return again. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Was here for 4 days for a company event in February 2013. I had a massive Suite that felt like it took 5 minutes to get from one side to the other. Great views over the Atlantic, especially in the morning for sunrise around 7am. Staff friendly and courteous.
reviews.title: Great views, fantastic room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Trump from Feburary 3rd to the 8th and it was just ok. We were disappointed in the accomdations as with the Trump name one would expect perfection. Beds were comfortable and rooms clean. Meals at the hotel are WAY over priced, so eat somewhere else. The concierge was not that helpful and in fact gave us mis information about the miami city/boat tour which caused problems for us that day. There were better hotels in the area that we would stay at next time. It is also important to note that this hotel reeked of Marijuana! The hallways and especially the elevators smelled really bad. We noticed that about 3 floors below us people were smoking pot off their balcony and the smoke was coming directly into our room. We will likely not stay here again if we return to the area
reviews.title: Just average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: our 40th anniversary, needed nice quiet place to unwind.very courteous and quiet place, beach area and swimming facilities are great, good with little things like, providing lemon water and setting for beach .
reviews.title: Great vacation spot for weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the resort about 20 minutes till 4:00 and was told our room was not ready ( maybe just me, but really?) so we went to the bar, had a drink and returned to check in at 4:00 and checked in. DO NOT expect to get a early check in!
reviews.title: Expected a little more of a Trump property
Highly recommended
reviews.text: The Trump Sonesta Sunny Isles was the perfect location for my wife's and my honeymoon. After much searching and debate, we decided on Miami, as our honeymoon destination, and the Trump Sonesta Sunny Isles as our home away from home for five days. After a long week leading up to the wedding, we wanted quiet and elegance, but we also wanted the convenience of activities and nightlife. So, we opted for North Miami Beach, which is only about 20-25 minutes from South Beach via car. The location was ideal! The beach and the pool are great, with excellent service by beach boys, who set up umbrellas and bring you towels and drinks and food, upon request. There are also jet skis, canoeing and other water activities in which to partake. The hotel staff, overall, were magnificent, even remembering our names. John, I believe that he is a manager at the front desk and Oscar, a bellman, were two of the many who made our stay INCREDIBLE!!! I also loved the cosmopolitan feel of this hotel. Spanish, French, German, Chinese, English...it is all spoken here. I cannot believe that people give this hotel a bad review. My wife and I would definitely recommend this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel with excellent facilities. Car/bus trip to South Beach if you wish to be there but close to Aventura Mall, Bal Harbour, golf courses. hotel has 2 interesting swimming pools, tennis courts etc. Ideal location if you don't want to be surrounded by noise etc. Excellent bus routes if you don't have/want a car. Extremely comfortable & great service.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for about 5 nights all of which were very relaxing. The food selection, service, and professionalism of the staff was impeccable. The hotel is right on the water and offers a beautiful view. This was truly a rewarding romantic getaway. We'll definitely be coming back.
reviews.title: Loved it!!!!!!!!!!!

likes.disliked: — 20 minute cab ride to South Beach

reviews.text: Excellent hotel, pool, service, restuarant, room. BUT forget trying to check in a minute BEFORE check in time, we cruised to miami and drove to the Trump Sonesta Beach Resort, we got there 9:30AM and knew we where early and would most likely have to wait to check in, so when I got there and Andreas at the front desk gave me an id card for the pool and beach and told me he would call me when my room was ready. I thought great, so my husband and 12 year old son and I went to check out the the pool and beach area, we were very excited it was beautiful. We went back to the lobby and sat on the very comfortable chairs, my husband fell asleep, (we were up since 5 am to get off the ship), well arould 11 am I went up to ask Andreas if the room was ready, he said, not yet, so I went back to sit down. At around 1 pm I went up again (not very happy) to Andreas, he said, no not yet, well finally at 3 pm my husband was annoyed. He went up to Andreas and he said the room was still not ready, then my husband asked to speak to the manager, Daniel DeMoura. My husband told him we have been here for 5.5 hours waiting for our room, he said he asked housekeeping and they are not ready yet and they said "well check in isn't until 4pm", I said we have never been to a hotel they didn't accommodate the guest if they arrived early, he said he would call us when our room was ready, basically he didn't care, well at 3:50 they called to tell us our room was ready.
reviews.title: Great but.......

likes.liked: — The room, pool and ocean view

reviews.text: We were upset because we were up since 5am and we wasted an entire day of our 3 days in the lobby, if they would have told us we were not getting in our room till 4pm we would not have sat there ALL DAY, I did read that from ours that they don't check you in early. Other than that experience the hotel was great. We did see lots of stingrays and fish and a shark from our balcony. I would go back in a heart beat but NOT BEFORE 4PM!!!!
reviews.title: A wonderful vacation

likes.disliked: — The elevators were a tad slow, expecially when staying on the 27th floor

reviews.title: The staff is fantastic!
reviews.text: We just returned from our 2nd stay at Trump Sonesta (Feb 8-11). We had an oceanfront room on the 28th floor. The view is beautiful!

reviews.title: it was just amazing!!!!!
reviews.text: For the price, the rooms are just OK - nothing fancy. We had 2 queen sized beds (there are no king beds unless you get a suite). The bathroom is nice.

reviews.title: Great views - but not certain it's worth the price
reviews.text: The staff is amazing. We returned to this hotel this year because of the incredible service. The staff is very pleasant. They were calling us by name on the first day. They are very helpful and professional.

reviews.title: The beach is the thing
reviews.text: The food and drinks are pricey but that's to be expected in the area. There is a Publix within walking distance.

reviews.title: Loved It....would return in a flash
reviews.text: There's a great restaurant a few blocks down, Timo. Delicious food and a very nice wine list.

aka: Trump International Beach Hotel Sunny Isles Beach
description: This contemporary Mobil 4-star oceanfront resort features its own private and pristine beachfront, plus a delightful grotto-style pool complex with two pools, fountains, waterfalls hot tubs and cabanas. Known as one of the best Miami luxury hotels, Trump Beach Resort in Sunny Isles offers 360 oversized guest rooms and suites, each with a private balcony and spectacular views of the Atlantic Ocean or Intracoastal Waterway. Relax and enjoy Miami, Trump-style!
